item.title: What is Agile, anyway?
item.description: I was recently confronted with very interesting misconception: that Agile and SCRUM are the same thing. It really got me thinking. First, it means that one must be very careful when using the word “agile” in software development context. Less obvious: SCRUM is de facto standard agile method today, and very often the only one people know or heard about. Wikipedia lists 10+ different methods falling under “Agile” umbrella. It’s no suprise because agile manifesto is very vague and does not really tell much (if anything) about the how part.
